TopicTitle: Mod that lists your biome and position (landed, low over, etc.)?

Articles.Content: Are there any mods out there with this specific function? I know there are plenty of mods that have this feature, but I don't want to get some huge information mod just for this.

KER and MJ aren't that huge....

Theres a couple science plugins that probably do this though, sciencealert maybe?

KER and MJ display it.

Science Alert detects it, not sure if it displays it anywhere.

ScanSAT makes it more interesting all around.
also VOID, as that's based largely on Engineer

I have Engineer, however this doesn't help in career mode if I don't have an engineer, KER part, etc. on my ship.

And like I said, I don't want to get a bigger mod (MJ and especially VOID are) just for this one thing.

There's also StockPlugins ([http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/99869](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/99869)) which is a pre-made module manager config that does that. Or just set the setting in KER's config file to not require the part.

> 
> You could use a Module Manager config (or manually add) to add a ModuleGPS to all command parts.
> Something like:
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
>     @PART[*]:HAS[@MODULE[ModuleCommand]]{     MODULE     {	    name = ModuleGPS     }}
> 
> 
> 
> 
> This will give you the planet name, lat/long, and biome at your current position in the right-click menu for whatever part you add it to.

Huh, interesting. I'll do this if I can't find anything else.
